channel.title: U.S. Police Shooting Research Tracker
channel.description: Recent academic research on police shootings and use of deadly force

item.title: Prevention of Destructive Fishing in the Waters of Tual City: Effective Surveillance and Law Enforcement Strategies
item.description:
Authors: . et al.
Journal: International Journal of Multidisciplinary Research and Growth Evaluation

Destructive fishing in the waters of Tual City remains a significant environmental and socio-economic issue, threatening marine biodiversity and the livelihoods of local fishermen. This study analyzes the problem using a SWOT approach, identifying strengths such as existing government regulations and rich marine resources, weaknesses including limited enforcement capacity and economic dependence on harmful fishing practices, opportunities such as growing global demand for sustainable sea...
item.source: International Journal of Multidisciplinary Research and Growth Evaluation

item.title: Encounters with Photobooks
item.description:
Authors: Carlin, Briony
Journal: Unknown Journal

Photobooks are an art form on the move. They travel physically, as copies are bought, traded, treasured, forgotten, and rediscovered around the world. They move conceptually, as their meanings evolve through changing use and value. Photobooks combine languages of photography, text and design into a distinct medium that breaks from the confines of galleries and libraries, entering unexpected or intimate environments, such as our homes. Encounters with Photobooks marks a shift in scholars...

item.title: Police Violence and White Supremacist Terrorism
item.description:
Authors: Wolfendale, Jessica
Journal: American Torture and American Terrorism

Abstract Chapter 4 takes up the issue of white supremacist terrorism in America. While much scholarship on this issue focuses on the (very real) threat posed by nonstate white supremacist terrorism, this chapter reveals the complex and longstanding relationship between state and nonstate white supremacist terrorism. The complexity of this relationship makes it difficult to draw a neat distinction between state and nonstate forms of white suprema...

item.title: Displaying deadly police violence against Black people through government memorials
item.description:
Authors: Keyes & Keyes
Journal: Policing: An International Journal

Purpose The purpose of this article is to explore the understudied intersection of government-sponsored memorials of Black people alongside the demographics of police officers who were involved in their deaths and the emergence of government-sponsored memorials for Black people slain by police. Design/methodology/a...

item.title: Who makes the right call? Examining relationships between personality traits and situational performance in police cadets
item.description:
Authors: AlSabah et al.
Journal: Policing: An International Journal

Purpose Police institutions and practitioners often associate personality traits with an individual’s likelihood of success in policing, emphasizing certain psychological profiles as better suited for handling the stressful conditions inherent in police work. This study investigates personality traits and their potential relationship to critical aspects of police performance under stress–conceptualized as decisio...

item.title: The Binding Effect of Constitutional Court Decisions on Police Regulations (An Analysis of Constitutional Court Decision No. 114/PUU-XXIII/2025)
item.description:
Authors: Firmanto, Kiki
Journal: IBLAM LAW REVIEW

This study examines the binding force of Constitutional Court decisions on administrative regulations issued by the Indonesian National Police, with particular attention to the normative consistency between Police Regulation No. 10 of 2025 and the constitutional meaning articulated in Constitutional Court Decision No. 114/PUU-XXIII/2025. A normative legal research approach is employed through the analysis of constitutional norms, the hierarchy of laws and regulations, doctrines of consti...

item.title: “Convenience, Quickness, and Compassion”: Experiences of People Involved in the Criminal‐Legal System Accessing Medications for Opioid Use Disorder Services From a Mobile Unit in Chicago
item.description:
Authors: Martinford et al.
Journal: Health Expectations

ABSTRACT Background This study aimed to explore the experiences of people diagnosed with opioid use disorder (OUD) and recently involved with the criminal‐legal system (CLS) as they received addiction treatment services from a Mobile Medications for Opioid Use Disorder (MOUD) programme in Chicago. By assessing perceptions and satisfaction with receiving addiction treatme...

item.title: Smoke Poetics: The Wapping Coal Riot, the Marine Police, and Romantic Forms of Urbanity
item.description:
Authors: Whittell, Jesslyn
Journal: Humanities

This paper reads coal as a metonym for London’s social fabric in the writings of police theorist Patrick Colquhoun, the archival reports on the Wapping Coal Riot, and the anti-carceral poetry of William Blake. In 1798, at the behest of the West India Committee, Colquhoun had developed the first modern police force, the Thames River Police, which predated Robert Peel’s metropolitan police by over 20 years. Colquhoun’s “Treatise on the Commerce and Police of the River Thames” (1800) center...

item.title: Implementasi Pelatihan Vokasional Berbasis IPTEK untuk Meningkatkan Efisiensi Operasional dan Kompetensi Warehouse Operation Officer
item.description:
Authors: Ashari et al.
Journal: Jurnal Pengabdian Masyarakat dan Penelitian Terapan

Kegiatan pengabdian kepada masyarakat ini bertujuan meningkatkan kompetensi sumber daya manusia di sektor logistik melalui program pelatihan dan sertifikasi profesi Warehouse Operation Officer (WOO) yang berlisensi Badan Nasional Sertifikasi Profesi (BNSP). Program ini merupakan kolaborasi antara Institut Transportasi dan Logistik (ITL) TRISAKTI dan PT Sadikun Niagamas Raya, yang dilaksanakan pada 7 Oktober 2025 di Kampus Pascasarjana ITL TRISAKTI, Jakarta. Metode pelaksanaan menggunakan...
item.source: Jurnal Pengabdian Masyarakat dan Penelitian Terapan

item.title: The impact of officer tenure on injury outcomes in law enforcement encounters
item.description:
Authors: Lomenzo et al.
Journal: The Police Journal: Theory, Practice and Principles

Police use-of-force encounters, though rare, pose serious injury risks. This study examines whether officer tenure predicts injury outcomes for both officers and suspects during use-of-force incidents. Using logistic regression on 762 Miami-Dade cases (2002–2006), this study finds that officer tenure was not linked to officer injury but negatively predicted suspect injury. Experienced officers may manage encounters more effectively, reducing harm. Conducted energy device (CED) use corres...
item.source: The Police Journal: Theory, Practice and Principles

item.title: ASSESSING THE PERCEIVED EFFECTIVENESS OF POLICE TRAINING PROGRAMS: A CROSS-SECTIONAL STUDY ON OFFICER PREPAREDNESS AND REAL-WORLD APPLICATION
item.description:
Authors: Rhem N. Rick Corpuz et al.
Journal: EPRA International Journal of Multidisciplinary Research (IJMR)

Evaluating the effectiveness of police training is essential in ensuring that officers are adequately prepared to meet the demands of modern law enforcement. This study quantitatively examines the effectiveness of police training programs by assessing officers’ preparedness and the practical application of acquired skills in real-life situations. The study focuses on scenario-based training, ethical decision-making, and physical readiness. A cross-sectional survey research design was emp...
item.source: EPRA International Journal of Multidisciplinary Research (IJMR)

item.title: METHODOLOGICAL AND THEORETICAL FUNDAMENTALS OF FORMATION OF OFFICER PROFESSIONAL CULTURE AS A TOPICAL PROBLEM OF MILITARY PROFESSIONAL TRAINING
item.description:
Authors: Marchenko & Zelenskaya
Journal: Education in the 21st Century

The article substantiates the expediency of clarifying the essence of the concept of ‘professional culture of the officer’ from the standpoint of new methodological approaches: axiological, acmeological, competence-based, resource-oriented, and system-synergetic. The extended interpretation emphasizes the relevance of the issue in the modern context of military operations, taking into account the transformation of values, the technological progress of warfare, and the changing requiremen...

item.title: Sex-specific Lean Mass Changes during Marine Corps Officer Candidates School and Associations with Physical Health, Performance and Military Readiness
item.description:
Authors: Koltun et al.
Journal: Medicine & Science in Sports & Exercise

Individuals participating in military training are subject to physical training that can affect body mass and composition in a manner that may be dependent on sex and relate to physical health and performance. Purpose: This investigation compared changes in body composition between sexes during Marine Corps Officer Candidates School (OCS), and explored potential associations wit...

item.title: Gender-Based Violence Concerns, Trust in Police and Support for Defunding the Police
item.description:
Authors: Updegrove & Craig
Journal: The British Journal of Criminology

Abstract Public opinion research has yet to fully consider the various contexts in which people evaluate calls to defund the police and how those contexts may relate to or interact with popular constructs like trust in police. Because Americans are socialized to view police as the primary response to gender-based violence, people concerned about gender-based violence may perceive that defunding would negatively impact responses to this issue. Us...
